jorisvandenbossche commented on a change in pull request #10592:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10592#discussion_r657772988



##########
File path: docs/source/python/filesystems.rst
##########
@@ -173,10 +173,12 @@ some environment variables.
 
   .. code-block:: shell
 
-      export CLASSPATH=`$HADOOP_HOME/bin/hdfs classpath --glob`
+      export CLASSPATH=`$HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop classpath --glob`
+      # or on Windows
+      %HADOOP_HOME%/bin/hadoop classpath --glob > %CLASSPATH%

Review comment:
       Do we have someone who can confirm this is correct / working for Windows?

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
In the "legacy" python-specific HadoopFileSystem implementation, we have a {{_maybe_set_hadoop_classpath}} function which has some logic to set the {{CLASSPATH}} environment variable based on {{HADOOP_HOME}} or the hadoop executable: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/c43fab3d621bedef15470a1be43570be2026af20/python/pyarrow/hdfs.py#L134-L149

This is also mentioned in the documentation of the new HadoopFileSystem (https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/filesystems.html#hadoop-file-system-hdfs ):

> If CLASSPATH is not set, then it will be set automatically if the hadoop executable is in your system path, or if HADOOP_HOME is set.

However, this sentence was probably simply copied over from the docs about the legacy filesystem. And for the new HadoopFileSystem implementation, we don't have this logic to automatically set up {{CLASSPATH}}. 

Do we want to add this logic to the new implementation as well? (in cython, or actually in C++?) Or if not, we should update the docs to clarify that {{CLASSPATH}} is actually required.

cc [~apitrou]
fields.summary: [C++][Python] HadoopFileSystem: automatically set CLASSPATH based on HADOOP_HOME env variable?

comments.body:
> Another thing we can do is simply document how to set the CLASSPATH from a command line, which is actually simple

The linux version is actually already included in the docs.  The windows version could be added.

I can't judge how useful this automatic setting is (to what extent users already need to deal with this env variable, or whether they otherwise only need to set HADOOP/JAVA_HOME, etc), but so if it is complicated/costly, I am personally certainly fine with simply updating the documentation to reflect the current situation that CLASSPATH is required.
Besides the cost (users may be surprised that in some cases there is an implicit subprocess spawn), silently altering the environment from a library such as Arrow makes me a bit uneasy.

{quote}I can't judge how useful this automatic setting is (to what extent users already need to deal with this env variable, or whether they otherwise only need to set HADOOP/JAVA_HOME, etc), but so if it is complicated/costly, I am personally certainly fine with simply updating the documentation to reflect the current situation that CLASSPATH is required.{quote}

I agree, especially if the way in which we automatically set {{CLASSPATH}} in the legacy implementation sometimes did not work and still required users to set {{CLASSPATH}} manually, as seems to be the case in ARROW-9019.
OK, I will do a quick PR to update the docs reflecting this.
Postponing it to 6.0 so we can verify that the patch works.
